section.section: A special examiner and the Board of Appeals shall conduct a hearing or appeal in a manner that ascertains the substantial rights of the parties.
A special examiner and the Board of Appeals are not bound by statutory or common law rules of evidence or technical rules of procedure.
A special examiner and the Board of Appeals shall consider evidence offered in accordance with § 10-213 of the State Government Article.
A person may not participate on behalf of the Board of Appeals in any proceeding in which the person has a direct or indirect interest.
Except as provided in subparagraph (ii) of this paragraph, ex parte communications are subject to § 10-219 of the State Government Article.
Section 10-219(d) of the State Government Article does not apply to ex parte communications under this subtitle.

A special examiner or the Board of Appeals may consolidate claims by more than 1 individual or claims by a single individual for 2 or more weeks of unemployment if:
the same or substantially similar evidence is relevant and material to the matters at issue; and
in the judgment of the special examiner or the Board of Appeals, the consolidation would not be prejudicial to a party.
A record shall be kept, in accordance with § 10-218 of the State Government Article, of all testimony and proceedings before a special examiner or the Board of Appeals.

Testimony need not be transcribed unless:
judicial review is initiated; or
the Board of Appeals orders a transcription.
A witness who is subpoenaed under this subtitle is entitled to compensation at a rate that the Board of Appeals sets.
The compensation of a witness who is subpoenaed on behalf of the Board of Appeals or a claimant shall be considered part of the expense of administering this title.

text.section: The Board of Appeals or representative of the Board of Appeals may not charge a claimant a fee in any proceeding under this title.

section.section: The Board of Appeals promptly shall give each party to a proceeding before it written notice of its decision by mailing the notice to each party at the last known address of the party or business address of a licensee in accordance with § 10-209(a) of the State Government Article, or otherwise delivering the notice.

The notice shall:
include the findings of fact and conclusions of law that support the decision;
be accompanied by any order necessary to give effect to the decision; and
conform to the requirements of § 10-221 of the State Government Article.
